definition: face/side/surface/aspect/top/classifier for flat surfaces such as drums, mirrors, flags etc

sentences.english: The young farmer smiled a springtime smile.
sentences.chinese: 那年輕的農夫滿面春風地笑了。

sentences.english: Easily meet your opposite sex, so enjoy your courtship.
sentences.chinese: 身邊不斷會有異性出現，滿面春風，與異性十分投契。

sentences.english: She arrived bright and early for the appointment.
sentences.chinese: 她滿面春風早早地赴約來了。

sentences.english: Your presentation must have gone well. You look like the cat that swallowed the canary .
sentences.chinese: 你的發言反響一定不錯，你看起來滿面春風的。

sentences.english: Her face blazed with enthusiasm and happiness.
Eric just breezed in, full of the good news .
sentences.chinese: 埃裏克滿面春風地進來，帶來的全是好消息。

sentences.english: Stem, the leadership face wreathed in smilesly carry wine cup to arrive next toast go to.
sentences.chinese: 幹罷，領導滿面春風地端着酒杯到下一桌敬酒去了。

sentences.english: I am looking for a skirt to go with this sweater.
sentences.chinese: 你今天看上去滿面春風，什麼事讓你高興起來了。

sentences.english: His face was lighted (lit) up with excitement.
The student was all smiles when he got the highest score on the test.
sentences.chinese: 那個學生在考試中得到最高分，顯得滿面春風的。

definition: sick personnel/person on the sick list/patient
to whisper to one another's ear
please excuse me for not complying/to politely decline
see 驚慌失措|惊慌失措[jing1 huang1 shi1 cuo4]
lit. killing the chicken to warn the monkey (idiom)/fig. to punish an individual as an example to others/pour encourager les autres
not to glance sideways (idiom)/to gaze fixedly/to be fully concentrated/to preserve a correct attitude
to return something to its rightful owner
to nod one's head and bow (idiom); bowing and scraping/unctuous fawning
variant of 定親|定亲[ding4 qin1]
